Supreme Verdict.reasoning: Uncounterable board wipe that represents a specific variant of mass removal, useful for testing both functional equivalence and strict upgrades/downgrades

Thassa's Oracle.reasoning: Key win condition in combo decks that specifically cares about library manipulation and alternative win conditions

Birds of Paradise.reasoning: The quintessential one-mana mana dork that appears in multiple formats. Perfect for testing similarity with other mana-producing creatures and acceleration effects.

Cabal Coffers.reasoning: Powerful Commander land that demonstrates strong synergistic relationships with specific card types (Swamps) and other mana doublers. Tests for both mana engine pieces and black-focused synergies.

Jace, the Mind Sculptor.reasoning: One of the most powerful planeswalkers ever printed, representing blue-based control strategies. Tests for both high-impact card advantage engines and control finishers.

Birthing Pod.reasoning: Banned card that defined its own archetype and demonstrates unique tutoring mechanics. Tests for both creature-based toolbox strategies and sacrifice-based value engines.

Goblin Guide.reasoning: Iconic aggressive creature that defines the Modern Burn archetype and represents the aggressive red creature benchmark. Perfect for testing similarity with other efficient red creatures and burn deck staples.

Craterhoof Behemoth.reasoning: Classic Commander finisher that works specifically in token and creature-based strategies. Essential for testing similarity with other game-ending creatures and mass pump effects.

Urza's Tower.reasoning: Part of the iconic Tron land package that defines an entire Modern archetype. Perfect for testing land-based synergies and big mana enablers.

Blood Moon.reasoning: Iconic land hate permanent that tests for similar mana denial and punishment effects.

Yawgmoth's Will.reasoning: Powerful graveyard recursion spell that defines vintage storm strategies, testing for similar game-breaking effects.

Stoneforge Mystic.reasoning: Equipment tutor that creates its own archetype, perfect for testing equipment-based synergies and tutoring effects.

Ephemerate.reasoning: Common-rarity flicker effect that tests for similar cheap temporary exile effects, particularly relevant in Pauper.

Urza, Lord High Artificer.reasoning: Powerful artifact commander that tests for both artifact synergies and mana generation capabilities.

Collected Company.reasoning: Instant-speed creature cheating spell that defines several Modern archetypes, testing for similar creature-putting effects.

Lion's Eye Diamond.reasoning: Unique zero-cost artifact that tests for both fast mana and discard synergies in combo decks.

Griselbrand.reasoning: Premier reanimation target that tests similarity based on powerful creatures often cheated into play

Omnath, Locus of Creation.reasoning: Multi-color value engine that defines certain Standard and Modern archetypes, testing similarity based on landfall and elementals

Monastery Swiftspear.reasoning: Aggressive creature that defines prowess and burn strategies across multiple formats, perfect for testing aggro synergies.

Wrath of God.reasoning: Classic board wipe that has seen numerous variants printed over the years, perfect for testing functional substitutes.

Atraxa, Praetors' Voice.reasoning: Popular commander that defines specific deck building approaches and has clear mechanical synergies with certain card types.

Rhystic Study.reasoning: Commander staple that demonstrates a unique card advantage engine, useful for finding similar strategic effects.

Snapcaster Mage.reasoning: Format-defining creature that specifically synergizes with instants and sorceries, perfect for testing spell-based synergies.

Cyclonic Rift.reasoning: Commander-defining asymmetric board wipe that tests for similar powerful instant-speed mass removal effects

Emrakul, the Aeons Torn.reasoning: Ultimate reanimation target that represents the highest end of powerful creatures with cast/cheat effects

Fury.reasoning: Free spell with elemental evoke mechanic that serves as premium removal. Important to find similar free interaction spells and creature-based removal.

Phyrexian Arena.reasoning: Classic enchantment-based card advantage engine. Important benchmark for finding similar sustained card draw effects.

Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth.reasoning: Utility land that enables specific strategies and combos. Tests for both mana-fixing and land-based synergies.

Living End.reasoning: Build-around cascade combo card that defines its own archetype. Tests for both cascade spells and mass reanimation effects.

Archmage's Charm.reasoning: Flexible control spell that shows the importance of modal spells. Tests for finding similar versatile answers and interaction.

Risen Reef.reasoning: Tribal value engine that exemplifies elemental synergies. Important for finding similar tribal payoffs and value creatures.

Mishra's Bauble.reasoning: Zero-mana artifact that enables specific synergies and strategies. Tests ability to find cards that enable similar deck velocity and synergy patterns.

Llanowar Elves.reasoning: Iconic one-mana accelerant that defines a whole category of similar effects. Essential for testing the system's ability to identify mana-producing creatures.

Scavenging Ooze.reasoning: Versatile creature that combines graveyard hate with lifegain and growth. Tests system's ability to identify cards with multiple overlapping utilities.

Survival of the Fittest.reasoning: Powerful tutor engine that enables creature-based toolbox strategies. Excellent for testing cards that enable consistent access to situational answers.

Entomb.reasoning: Key enabler for reanimator strategies across multiple formats. Perfect for testing cards that enable graveyard-based strategies.

Sanctifier en-Vec.reasoning: Powerful sideboard card that hoses multiple strategies. Excellent test case for evaluating hate cards and silver bullets.

Grave Titan.reasoning: Classic reanimation target that represents both immediate value and ongoing threat. Good test for high-end creatures with similar impact.

Ashen Rider.reasoning: Powerful enter/leave-the-battlefield effect creature that's primarily used in reanimator strategies, testing similarity for both reanimation targets and exile effects.

Xenagos, God of Revels.reasoning: Popular Commander card that tests similarity for both combat enhancers and indestructible enchantment creatures.

Street Wraith.reasoning: Unique card with cycling for zero mana, testing similarity for both free spells and life payment effects.

Intangible Virtue.reasoning: Classic token enhancement enchantment that tests similarity for both token strategies and anthem effects.

Inkmoth Nexus.reasoning: Key land in infect strategies that tests similarity for both creature-lands and poison counter synergies.

Jace's Ingenuity.reasoning: Basic instant-speed card draw spell that tests similarity for standard control deck card advantage options.

Enlightened Tutor.reasoning: Efficient tutor that finds artifacts or enchantments. Tests similarity for tutoring effects across different card types.

Force of Negation.reasoning: Modern-legal free counterspell that follows Force of Will's design pattern. Tests similarity for free interaction spells.

Esper Sentinel.reasoning: Modern staple that represents white card draw and tax effects. Important to identify similar effects in white's color pie.

Force of Vigor.reasoning: Free spell that represents efficient artifact/enchantment removal. Tests for both alternate cost spells and similar removal effects.

Amulet of Vigor.reasoning: Key combo piece that enables specific land-based strategies. Tests for both combo enablers and land-based synergies.

Mox Opal.reasoning: Powerful artifact-based acceleration that tests for both fast mana and metalcraft mechanics. Important to identify similar fast mana sources.

Skullclamp.reasoning: A banned card in multiple formats that represents a powerful draw engine with specific deck building requirements. Tests similarity for cards that generate extreme card advantage through creature sacrifice.

Bloodbraid Elf.reasoning: Cascade creature that exemplifies Jund's value-oriented midrange strategy, perfect for testing both mechanical and strategic similarities.

Necropotence.reasoning: One of the most powerful card advantage engines ever printed, excellent for testing similarity of other powerful draw effects and life-for-cards effects.

Doomsday.reasoning: Complex combo enabler that tests for both strategic similarity (combo pieces) and functional similarity (deck manipulation effects).

Walking Ballista.reasoning: Versatile artifact creature that fits in multiple strategies, testing both +1/+1 counter synergies and damage-dealing abilities.

Archon of Cruelty.reasoning: Premier reanimation target that represents high-impact creatures with strong ETB and attack triggers. Tests similarity across different reanimator finishers.

Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx.reasoning: Core engine piece for devotion strategies that tests both mana production and archetype-specific synergies. Represents powerful land-based mana engines.

Yawgmoth, Thran Physician.reasoning: Complex creature that enables multiple synergy-based strategies including -1/-1 counters, sacrifice themes, and combo potential. Tests ability to find both combo pieces and value-oriented similar cards.
